case_title: SHAMSHAD ALI and others vs MUHAMMAD HANIF and others

accussed_details.name: N/A
allegation: Fraudulent alteration of death dates to invalidate mutations

complaint_summary: The appellants challenged the decision of EDO (Rev.) dated 25-1-2006, alleging partiality and collusion with the respondents to invalidate mutations Nos.1423 to 1426 based on fraudulent alteration of death dates.
investigation_summary: The EDO (Rev.) examined records from two Union Councils and found discrepancies in the death dates of the general power of attorney givers, leading to the conclusion that the mutations were invalid.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the revision petition, affirming that the mutations were invalid as the power of attorney givers had died prior to their attestation. The court upheld the EDO (Rev.)'s decision under the West Pakistan Land Revenue Act, 1967, barring Civil Courts from intervening in revenue matters.
legal_arguments: Appellants argued that the EDO (Rev.) misread tampered death dates and improperly adjudicated a civil matter under revenue law.
Respondents argued that the EDO (Rev.) acted impartially, relying on corroborated evidence from Union Council records to invalidate the mutations.
witnesses: Secretary of the distant Union Council

witness_statement.Secretary of Union Council: Corroborated discrepancies in death dates recorded in distant Union Council.

key_issues: Validity of mutations based on power of attorney
Jurisdiction of Civil Courts in revenue matters

legal_terms.Mutation: A change or transfer in ownership of property in revenue records.
legal_terms.Presumption of Truth: Revenue records are presumed to be accurate unless proven otherwise.

words_and_phrases.In limine: At the outset; without further consideration.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the validity of mutations based on power of attorney, with allegations of fraudulent alteration of death dates. The court upheld the EDO (Rev.)'s decision under revenue law, dismissing the revision petition.
